snippet: With a Scottish vote on independence two months away, Britain is lobbying America to allow imports of the delicacy made from sheep’s innards, which the United States banned for consumption in 1971.
abstract: British government is lobbying United States government to allow importation of haggis, Scottish delicacy made from sheep's innards, in bid to gain Scotland's favor ahead of its planned referendum on independence; consumption of sheep lungs, component of haggis, has been banned in America since 1971, and British lamb has been banned there since 1989.
lead_paragraph: With a Scottish vote on independence two months away, Britain is lobbying America to allow imports of the delicacy made from sheep’s innards, which the United States banned for consumption in 1971.

headline.main: It’s Tasty and Political: Britain Presses U.S. on Haggis
headline.print_headline: It’s Tasty and Political: Britain Presses U.S. on Haggis
